metadata.name: Charcoal Brutalism #95
metadata.description:
Based on a similar technique as "Charcoal Landscapes", using lines limited to 8 possible directions, this work is about the repetition of patterns at different scales and the use of negative spaces.
The texture created from the noise combined with the structures that emerges from this algorithm create a look similar to the brutalist architecture of the last century.

There are 10 scale variations but with almost infinite possible outcomes.
Inverted colours have a small chance of dropping.

Original artwork by William Watkins · Lyon, 2022

metadata.name: Mythic Latent Glitches  #96
metadata.description:
What is even real and what is artificial?

In the contemporary light, the division between real and artificial loses weight as the concepts become more and more intertwined. In this work, the artist combines the human and generative inputs, in a counterintuitive manner, by allowing AI to design the organic elements and using the human hand to incorporate artificial glitches. What seemingly emerges as natural forms, was imagined solely by GAN, seeing the world through the limited examples through the photographer’s lenses. Artist’s role is also reversed, as their goal is to design the visual destruction process of the organic forms. Glitch is a malfunction of perception, it symbolizes the confusion caused by not being able to comprehend. 

The human fascination with metaphysical forces spans many centuries. While Pagan mythology created gods living in deep forests and under-explored territories, nowadays we approach technology with somewhat similar awe, fascination, and fear. 

The project has been developed in multiple stages. It started with an inspiration by the Lithuanian landscape and research of the ancient myths and legends. The photography aimed at capturing the mysterious, spanning months and years of different experiences. A custom pre-trained artist’s GAN model was then trained on a collection of several hundred photographs in high resolution. Selected outputs were curated by artist and included as a starting canvas for the next stage. Then, a set of stochastic manipulations were programmed to create alternative narratives through the visual destruction. Fog turns into smoke into burning radioactive forest in an unpredictable manner, guided by the random variables, their boundaries crafted by artist.  

Read more on the project website:
ivonatau.com/mythic-latent-glitches

- Use the "A" key to animate (if "Animated" feature is present).
- Press any key to stop the animation.
- Use the "S" key to export an image.

metadata.name: monogrid 1.1 CE #77
metadata.description:
Each monogrid artwork gets initialized with a start up algorithm that builds up a set of rectangles and fills them with pixels. There are two different styles, 'Pixel' and 'Line', to create the initial image.

There is a set of 16 animations at work. 4 noise based animations, 4 shifting animations, 4 modulo based animation and 4 reset animations, all run in parallel. Each animation selects a rectangle from the initial setup and edits the pixels in this area. The selection process runs independently and animations can overlap which results in a new style of animation.

monogrid 1.1 is based on the original series at https://monogrid.xyz, but there are no black/white versions included. The color palette is a mixture of one of 12 colors plus black or white.
The fragment shader has been updated in the way the 16 different animations get summed up. This version would appear more chaotic and organic.

monogrid 1.1 - Collectors Edition
Kim Asendorf, 2022

metadata.name: Bound #299
metadata.description:
Knots bind and hold, mark time, and unite. But the power of a well-tied knot isn't only to fasten – it also symbolizes how tightly one holds their pledges. Whether a commitment to a partner, community, or oneself – the longevity of a deeply held bond is often marked with a symbol of passing time, like knots tied in a rope.

Let these ropes remind us of the binds we hold – new ones, lengthy ones, unbreakable ones, and even those we’ve had to untie. In plain view, these knots invite us to contemplate what our bonds mean to us, and to see them anew.

---

Press ‘1’-’9’ to increase resolution
Press 's' to save an image of the output at the current resolution

Created with p5.js
For third party license information, please see license.md

---

TENDER x David Brice Allen
July 2022

metadata.name: Time Intertwined #53
metadata.description:
by Daeinc
May 2022

An exploration into time and motion. Two linear timelines - structural and surficial - are intertwined. By weaving these timelines at different points in time, almost infinite variations can be made. The changing relationship between the two creates dynamic and unique compositions and challenges the visual perception.

## Guide:
- Please note that the animation responds to window aspect ratio. This is an intentional behavior as part of interactivity. It reproduces the same outcome at the same ratio. 
- To export image at specific size, use URL parameters as below.
- See browser console for more info.
- Tested on MacOS 12.3.1 with Chrome 101.0

## Keyboard Interaction:
- [0] for exhibit. it switches to a different mode every 3 loops.
- [s] to export PNG image. use URL params for dimensions.
- [spacebar] to play/pause animation
- [1 ~ 5] for different play modes
- [1]: all 
- [2]: surficial 
- [3]: constant 
- [4]: all-constant
- [5]: structural
- [h] to toggle hi-DPI mode. (for retina display)

## URL Parameters:
- add parameters separated by ampersand to the URL ex. https://.../?fxhash=...&mode=exhibit&w=800&st=5.3
- [mode]: play mode (exhibit, all, surficial, constant, all-constant, structural)
- [w]: width. (ex. w=1200)
- [h]: height. (ex. h=600)
- [st]: structural timecode. up to 2 decimals (ex. st=4.31)
- [su]: surficial timecode. up to 2 decimals (ex. su=15.04)
- [co]: constant offset. up to 2 decimals (ex. co=7.4)
- [pr]: pixel ratio. set it to 2 (or press [h]) for hi-DPI screens.

## License
CC-BY-NC 4.0
Please refer to the included LICENSE.md for license information.
Libraries used: p5, canvas-sketch, canvas-sketch-util, keyframes, easing equations from easings.net

metadata.name: Divergent Convergence #73
metadata.description:
Compositions of shapes and noise, order and chaos. Where does order end and chaos begin?

- Press [ space ] or click to toggle animation
- Press [ r ] to reset
- Press [ s ] to save the current frame as a 3000x4000 PNG

Requires WebGL2
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Luminaries #109
metadata.description:
There is no light without dark.

Luminaries is a study in symmetry, contrast and flow, with a palette inspired by the twelve full moon names. Owning a Luminary enables you to request a signed print for an additional fee. 

You can learn more about features and prints at: https://www.phaust.art/luminary

Each Luminary is composed of moons in various phases. Their layout derived from a handful of geometries. They contrast with their surroundings: filled with glittering stars, inky strokes or solid colour. 

Backgrounds can split along lines of symmetry – with dark and light contrasting as strokes seamlessly flow across the two halves. 

Luminaries are alive. They’re in retrograde once a month, a day in which you’ll see yours in a new light.

------

Collection Size: 158. One for each of the confirmed moons in our solar system.

Palettes: 12 + 1. One for each of the full moons plus a rarer secret palette: Wolf, Snow, Worm, Pink, Flower, Strawberry, Buck, Sturgeon, Harvest, Hunter, Beaver, Cold, ????.

Retrograde: day of the month that your Luminary will change for one day only.

S: to save at high resolution. 

Prints: request from https://www.phaust.art/luminary

metadata.name: The Restoration Scheme: The Birth #57
metadata.description:
“The Birth” is the second episode of “The Restoration Scheme” Series. The work was based on Acropora intermedia. 

It’s a day after the full moon when the corals spawn simultaneously.

——

“The Restoration Scheme” Series
It’s a virtual action extended from the coral restoration plan led by Delta Electronics Foundation from Taiwan, consisting of five generative corals. Each of them was based on five different species of coral as the theme.
If collectors mint virtual corals, Delta Electronics Foundation will drop coral seedlings collectively in the sea. 

The project is powered by FAB DAO (Formosa Art Bank). The split will donate to the local organization from Taiwan dedicated to the coral restoration scheme.

——

About Delta 
Climate change is causing irreversible impacts. Coral reefs, known for their rich biodiversity and the capability to nourish a quarter of marine life, are at the forefront of the crisis. Also known as "tropical rainforests" in the sea, coral reefs have experienced five mass bleaching events in the past five years. Once global warming exceeds the 2˚C threshold, it's likely that 99% of coral reefs will die off worldwide.

In addition to launching a coral restoration initiative along the northeast coast of Taiwan, Delta Electronics Foundation collaborates with Asia University to host "Earth Pulsing: Nurturing Life Exhibition" and releases the first art NFT featuring coral restoration. Through these actions, we hope to evoke public awareness of ecological issues. For more information, please visit https://delta50.deltaww.com/initiative/sea.html

——

Features

Depth: 6m, 12m, 18m
Corals: 1 ~ 8
Special: -

double click or press 's' to save as an image
made with p5.js and chroma.js

____________________________

《誕生》為《恢復方案》系列第二作，品種為中間軸孔珊瑚。

這是發生在滿月後的某一天，珊瑚集體產卵的日子。

——

《恢復方案》
恢復方案是虛擬演算珊瑚實驗，一系列共五件的生成珊瑚作品，每一件對應到特定珊瑚物種。本實驗與台達電子文教基金會合作，藏家每收藏一件 NFT，台達電子文教基金會就會實際在海中植下一株對應的珊瑚苗。這項專案與 FAB DAO （福爾摩沙藝術銀行）支援鑄造，部分分潤將直接捐助給台灣在地珊瑚保育組織，詳細資訊將於 FAB DAO Twitter 公佈。

——

關於台達電子文教基金會氣候變遷引發許多不可逆的環境衝擊，以豐富生物多樣性著稱、滋養四分之一海洋生物的珊瑚，便是首當其衝的受害者。
被譽為「海中熱帶雨林」的珊瑚生態系，已在最近五年遭遇三次大白化，一旦升溫跨越攝氏2℃，屆時恐有多達99％的珊瑚瀕臨滅絕。
近年在東北角投入珊瑚復育的台達電子文教基金會，今年與亞洲大學共同策畫「地球˙脈動中」生態與藝術特展，並合作發行全台首見的珊瑚生成藝術NFT，喚起社會大眾對生態議題的重視。更多資訊可參考: https://delta50.deltaww.com/initiative/sea.html

metadata.name: Flowers #253
metadata.description:
This project is inspired by natural flowers.
Flowers and foliage in the piece are arranged randomly, but they follow a regular pattern, as flowers do as they grow.
Initially, flowers are produced randomly and without color. Afterwards, the pieces are painted according to the color palettes, so that viewers can feel the effect of colors.
Each piece is processed until the frame part is reached.

Fully generated by p5.js

Press 's' to get a 3000x3000 px PNG file.

metadata.name: Equinox ☀ #46
metadata.description:
The equinox is upon us, you can feel it in nature.



- Berlin, January 2022 -

metadata.name: Cuts #66
metadata.description:
Cuts is an abstract representation of the exact moments in our lives when something is cut. It could be moving to a different country, being fired, quitting a bad habit, when a relationship ends or when you receive a very bad (or good!) news.
By themselves, cuts are not positive or negative events; it really depends on who you were before and who you wish to be after. But one thing is sure: every cut creates a new space that wasn’t there. This space could be small or huge, ordered or chaotic, regardless, you have to deal with it. Sometimes cuts try to resist and heal themselves extruding the core of the fibres we are made of, but they will fail. A cut is irreversible and it’s up to us to fill the gap with meaning.

Main features include:
- Curated palettes (21)
- Drawing modes (3)
- Extrusions (yes/no)
- Orientation (3)
- Overlapping (yes/no)
- Covered area (2)
- Cut position (2)

In live mode:
- Press [s] to save a 2400x2400 px image
- Press [t] to toggle shading (sometimes flat colours rock!)
- Press [c] to see copyright notice
- Press [f] to log features in console

By Todemashi 2022
NFT License 2.0

### NOTES
Made with p5js and GLSL shaders.
Shaders are based on tutorials and code by Patricio Gonzalez Vivo - The Book of Shaders - https://thebookofshaders.com/
